alert.message: Avg CPU IO Wait % is > 10 in ${application}
alert.name: Avg CPU IO Wait %

panels.description: iowait shows the percentage of time that the CPU was idle during which the system had an outstanding disk I/O request
panels.title: CPU IO Wait %

targets.expr: cpu_usage_user{env="$env", application="$application", host=~"$host", cpu="cpu-total"} + cpu_usage_system{env="$env", application="$application", host=~"$host", cpu="cpu-total"}
cpu_usage_user{env="prod", application=~"kafka.*", cpu="cpu-total"} + cpu_usage_system{env="prod", application=~"kafka.*", cpu="cpu-total"}

alert.message: Network Processor Avg Utilisation % alert is > 0.6 in ${application}
alert.name: Network Processor Avg Utilisation % alert

alert.message: Request Handler Average Idle % alert is < 0.4 in ${application}
alert.name: Request Handler Average Idle % alert

alert.message: Non-zero number of under-replicated partitions in ${application}
alert.name: Under Replicated Partitions alert

targets.expr: sum(max_over_time(diskio_read_bytes_rate{env="$env", application="$application", host=~"$host", name=~"nvme[1-9].*"}) + max_over_time(diskio_write_bytes_rate{env="$env", application="$application", host=~"$host", name=~"nvme[1-9].*"})) by (host)

sum(max_over_time(diskio_reads_rate{env="$env", application="$application", host=~"$host", name=~"nvme[1-9].*"}) + max_over_time(diskio_writes_rate{env="$env", application="$application", host=~"$host", name=~"nvme[1-9].*"})) by (host)

alert.message: Kafka Broker Disk Usage Alert is > 60 in ${application}
alert.name: Disk Usage alert

panels.description: Max used percentage across all data disks. Max is used because we want to track the least free disk.
panels.title: Data Disk Usage

panels.description: These values count the number of milliseconds that I/O requests have waited on this block device. If there are multiple I/O requests waiting, these values will increase at a rate greater than 1000/second; for example, if 60 read requests wait for an average of 30 ms, the read_time field will increase by 60*30 = 1800.
panels.title: Peak Write I/O Wait Time per Broker per Data Disk

panels.description: These values count the number of milliseconds that I/O requests have waited on this block device. If there are multiple I/O requests waiting, these values will increase at a rate greater than 1000/second; for example, if 60 read requests wait for an average of 30 ms, the read_time field will increase by 60*30 = 1800.
panels.title: Peak Read I/O Wait Time per Broker per Data Disk

panels.description: This value counts the number of milliseconds during which the device has had I/O requests queued.
panels.title: Peak IO Queued Time per Broker per Data Disk

panels.description:
This value counts the number of I/O requests that have been issued to the device driver but have not yet completed.
Sum of iops in progress aggregated across all data disks per broker
panels.title: IOPS In Progress

panels.description: Writes which are adjacent to each other may be merged for efficiency
panels.title: Merged Writes per Broker per Disk

alert.message: Log Disk Usage alert is > 50 in ${application}
alert.name: Log Disk Usage alert

alert.message: Root Disk Usage alert is > 50 in ${application}
alert.name: Root Disk Usage alert

alert.message: Fetch Consumer Avg Time alert is > 500 in ${application}
alert.name: Fetch Consumer Avg Time alert

alert.message: Failed Produce Rate alert is > 0 in ${application}
alert.name: Failed Produce Rate alert

panels.description: The rate at which log data is written to disk
panels.title: Log Flush Time

panels.description: Time spent in G1 Young Generation GC per second
panels.title: GC Collection Time Per Sec

panels.description: Used memory doesn't include buffers or cached data, actual RSS usage by all processes
panels.title: Memory Usage

panels.description:
pgpgin - KBs system paged in from the disk to memory.
pgpgout = KBs system paged out from memory to disk.
panels.title: Pages In & Out of Disk

dashboard.title: DP > Kafka > Cluster Level Metrics - Levitate
